section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Multi-drawing raffle" means a raffle for which the drawings are held on more than 1 day.
"Raffle" means one or more drawings using a single series of chances sold in chance books or similar devices, at which one or more prizes are awarded.
"Single-drawing raffle" means a raffle for which the drawings are held on a single day.

text.section: At a gaming event, the holder of a raffle may award a prize of money or merchandise using a chance book.

section.section: A single-drawing raffle may have only one major prize.

During a year, an organization listed in § 13-903 of this subtitle may hold not more than:
six single-drawing raffles in which the major prize is worth $2,500 or more; or
ten single-drawing raffles in which the major prize is worth less than $2,500.

An organization listed in § 13-903 of this subtitle may not hold:
more than 30 weekly drawings in a multi-drawing raffle;
more than two multi-drawing raffles during a year; or
a multi-drawing raffle in which the major prize is worth more than $1,100.
